title: Integrar el nuevo home en el codigo actual de BreatheCode
body:
Ahora que ya tienes listo el home, porque no lo integras con el codigo de este repositorio?

Esta montado sobre Gatsby.js

title: Node.js script to report how many articles are missing translation
body:
The following script is creating a json file with all the lessons in the platform:
https://github.com/breatheco-de/content/blob/master/generate-json.js

This is a sample of the json file being generated:
https://content.breatheco.de/static/api/lessons.json
```json
[
      {
            "slug": "[draft]mentoring-guidelines",
            "status": "draft",
            "title": "Mentor Guidelines",
            "date": "2017-09-24",
            "tags": [
                  "fale"
            ]
      },
      ...
]
```

We need to update that script to also include on the lesson object if the lesson is missing translation to Spanish or not.

Every lesson is supposed to have a spanish version with the same file name but ending on `.es.md` instead of just `.md`

For example, the lesson `learn-html.md` should have a `learn-html.es.md` alternative.

title: Update for React Lesson
body:
The lesson regarding React, located here
 https://github.com/breatheco-de/content/blob/master/src/content/lesson/learn-react-js-tutorial.md

Needs an update to the component lifecycle section. Methods like componentWillMount() were depreciated in React 17 and are no longer considered safe. 

We need to update the Wording and Diagram.

title: Allow adding an "author" property to the lessons, how-to or errors
body:
We would like to encourage more collaboration to the breathecode content, for that reason we decided to add an "author" property to each article that will show the github username of the author and a github card `when username is hovered or clicked with the mouse`. [This is an example](https://lab.lepture.com/github-cards/#alesanchezr|medium) of a github card we could add `on hover`:

![screen shot 2019-02-18 at 4 30 20 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/426452/52977233-845a4780-339a-11e9-8134-69e641e1741d.png)

The author has to be specified on the front-matter of the article like all the other metadata its being specified right now.

Here are the templates being used to render the articles right now:
https://github.com/breatheco-de/content/tree/master/src/templates

To finish this feature you would have to update the `<Cover>` component (made in react) and also make sure to include the new `author` attribute in the graphql query for each template, for example here is the query for the lesson.js template:
https://github.com/breatheco-de/content/blob/master/src/templates/lesson.js#L44

title: How-to: Form validations and prevent submission
body:
We need a max 500 characters blog post and 4 min max video tutorial with a small paragraph explaining how to prevent form submission if any inputs have invalid data. (form validations). Please do not explain how to send the data with ajax or fetch if the form is successfully validated.

The article must be written using markdown and published via Pull request on this folder (among the other articles):
https://github.com/breatheco-de/content/tree/master/src/content/how-to

The video can be published on your own youtube channel but you must put a link to the video at the beginning of the lesson.

como podemos hacer para tener ejemplos de codigo multilenguaje
hace falta el excerpt del lesson de jquery to js
faltan el ejemplo en js de sorting arrays
How to make your gihub shine
body:
We have to create a series of very clear steps to polish the github perfect for personal branding, here is some stuff that I can think of right now:

- [ ] Set your bio, links, and avatar.
- [ ] Start committing and pushing since day 1 of the academy.
- [ ] Every project you upload must have:
    1. [ ] very detailed README.md
    2. [ ] live demo (github pages).
    3. [ ] Very organized, clean code and comments.
- [ ] You must have your "baby boy" project. The one you are proud the most. And it must be pinned on the first slot.
- [ ] You need to have contributed on at least 5 external projects.
- [ ] You need to be a [github developer program](https://developer.github.com/program/), member. You can join for free and it gives you a badge on your profile.
- [ ] Don't ever say the word "new developer" or "junior developer"

title: How to install Node.js and NVM on a PC computer
body:
We need an article with clear instructions on how to install NVM and Node.js on a PC computer.

The article has to be written in markdown language following [these guidelines](https://github.com/breatheco-de/content/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
